Both work perfectly. No crack or anything required, just start the game. In case you can't start the game, you probably need to install new video drivers, or check the 'redist' folder in your game installation for additional drivers (PhysX, directX etc)

No one has a solution to the % issue that some of us have? =(

Found the solution to the % problem. If you let the game install itself into the folder it suggest to begin with then it wont happen. I really don't have a clue as to why changing the installation folder would fuck it up, but at least now the problem can be easily fixed if it happens for you.
If your game has stopped on the initial screen, try to uninstall EVERY version of Microsoft Virtual C++ and then install "vcredist_x86.exe" (from 'redist' folder. It should work now (hopefully)

It seems Skidrow update 1.0.9 is working on this release. Just use it like on skidrow rls, than start game with launcher. Working for me.

After installation whenever I try to run the .exe to start the game I get a full black screen that locks up my computer and requires a hard reset. Same thing happened with the other Endless Space REVOLT copy that comes bundled with the 1.09 update. Does anyone know a solution to this black screen?

UPDATE TO PREVIOUS COMMENT: Figured it out for myself. I tried installing all the .exe files from the "redist" subfolder of the game's directory. I also tried allowing administrator rights when executing the game launch .exe. What worked for me was disabling Comodo Firewall and then starting the game, alt-tabbing out of the game, then restarting Comodo. Hope this helps anyone else.

thanx for the upload HeroMaster. FUCK YOU .THE DARKNIGHT TEMPLARS. for your shit taste in music. I had to shut down my speackers just not to hear your install gay shit. At least have the decency and make a fucking button to stop it, not everyone likes that bitch whining.

Oh, Christ...you're gonna bitch about the f'n song in the installer?!? Seriously?! I thought it was fine, reminded me of Tron Legacy for some ungodly reason. You don't like it, hit the fuckin' mute...oh, no mute on the installer? Well, that's what the fuckin' Windows volume icon is for, dipshit. 

Anyway, the game is awesome. I played the 'alpha', which was really a late beta. (The alpha and beta periods before release lasted a whole 2 months! So, no, it wasn't an 'alpha' by traditional standards. Alpha's, in general, are considered barely running tech demos and prototypes. Not fully functional, tech complete games) This game really caught a lot of us 4x'ers off guard and the genre really needed this shot in the arm. Really lookin' forward to a sequel, if there will be one...
